answers.answer: New arrivals in Suceava can find information on how to manage in the city and who can help them. This includes details on important contacts, temporary protection, transportation, medical services, psychological support, education, and various support organizations.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Suceava Immigration Office can be contacted via email at sv.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0230 203 290, 0230 203 291, 0230 203 293, 0230 203 294, or 0230 203 295.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Important contacts'.
Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: One can register for temporary protection in Suceava County at the CRCPSA (Regional Center for Accommodation and Procedures for Asylum Seekers) Rădăuți and the Immigration Office of Suceava County.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Temporary protection in Suceava county'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees in Suceava can benefit from a free travel subscription for local public transport.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: For medical services, one can contact the Suceava Emergency Hospital, and for children's help, the Pediatric Department of the Suceava Emergency Hospital.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Organizations offering psychological support include World Vision Romania, Positive Progress psychological Solutions, Terre des hommes Foundation, Plan International Organization, and Save the Children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Several schools in Suceava county offer Ukrainian language teaching, including Breaza High School, Moldova Sulița High School, Izvoarele Sucevei Secondary School "Ion Aflorei", Ulma High School, Brodina High School, Bogdan Vodă High School, "Mihail Sadoveanu" High School, Lațcu Vodă Technical College, Petru Mușat High School, Baineț High School, Bălcăuti High School, Calafindești High School, Şerbăuți High School, Măriței High School, Mihai Eminescu Suceava National College, Vatra Moldoviței High School, and Vasile Cocea Moldovița Technological High School.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Support organizations operating in Suceava include CNRR (Romanian National Council for Refugees), eLiberare, AMURTEL, The Bucovina Institute Association, Save the Children, and The Sensiblu Foundation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Bucovina Institute Association offers diagnosis, evaluation, counseling, material support, support services, facilitating access to resources for vulnerable refugees, and Romanian and English language courses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Sensiblu Foundation can help women through social counseling, psychotherapy, legal advice and representation, a support network for women and girls, and by assisting with obtaining forensic medical certificates.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The provided content indicates a section for "Housing Info" but does not contain specific details about housing.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided content indicates a section for "Jobs" but does not contain specific details on how to find them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides support in accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: One can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services and support from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania, along with the expertise of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
